page.title: 17JOHNSON BROOK DUKINFIELD
page.content: {Johnson Brook}runs the whole length of a piece of open ground in{Dukinfield} and {Newton.}This open ground also consists of {playing fields, a golf {course and an old refuse tip.} Johnson Brook is a narrow, uneven, fairly shallow stream (20 cms. deep),part of which disappears underground. It is very polluted with metal, general refuse and waste from a nearby factory. In spite of this, it is abundant with water life, including {frogs, sticklebacks,shrimps }and { {pondskaters.} Around this area are trees such as { {weeping willow, oak, sycamore, beech {and elder. } Many birds are attracted to this area. {Starlings, magpies, sparrows, {thrushes, kestrels, pied wagtails, {blue tits and gulls}have been sighted. { }
